reporting-org.narrative: Ministry for Foreign Affairs of Finland

title.narrative: Finnpartnership: Peloton Challenge Arena - Co-creating solutions to big societal problems through challenge based innovation competitions.

description.narrative: Global megatrends such as the climate change are creating wicked challenges worldwide. Demos Helsinki is seeking to address those challenges by co-creating new socially and environmentally sustainable solutions in collaboration with different actors of the society such as higher education institutions and startups. This project will pilot the Peloton Challenge Arena in East Africa together with local partners. The Peloton Challenge Arena is a model developed and tested by Demos Helsinki - it combines an acc elerator program in the form of Peloton Innovation Camp and a challenge prize method to create new innovations and business models. The aim of the project is to establish a long-term cooperation models with the local partners. The project is planned to be implemented mainly during 2017. Nairobi Innovation Week offers an excellent platform for seeking and starting new partnerships further elaborating the project proposals and better understanding the needs of identified potential partners. Some of the most p romising partners include universities (e.g. University of Nairobi) and other higher education institutions essential innovation players such as development funders and donors foundations public sector institutions and investors. With these partners the pi lot will be implemented. On a longer perspective the Peloton Challenge Arena will have an impact on a) establishing a new entrepreneurial ecosystem around resource smart business models products and services b) facilitating new strategic partnerships betwe en different actors from the startups to academia and public institutions as well as c) strengthening the know-how and capabilities of the actors involved. The framework of this proposal will allow us to both create new partnerships with local institutions to local challenges and also try out different collaboration models and concepts. These concepts have been developed by Demos Helsinki but will be open for co-creation to fit the local needs and to strengthen local ownership of both the innovation methods tested and the results.
